poem:
"Monuments to the Forgotten"

Oh, the Danish landscape, woefully unbalanced-
robbed of woman's vibrant song.
In stone and bronze, the men advance,
while to mythical beasts the hymns belong.
In the shadows, a silenced dance,
a dearth of feminine strength so wrong.
Arise, ye Maidens of Copenhagen, in romance,
By stone, bronze and pride be finally held strong.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. According to the Danish government, only 31 of 321 statues and busts in Danish cities are of women. Of the 101 named statues in Copenhagen, only five are of women, while there are 26 dedicated". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
